definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: By so much is it a better agreement which we have through Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 既是起誓立的，耶穌就作了更美之約的中保。

sentences.english: Othello . by heaven , i ' ll know thy thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 奧瑟羅憑著上天起誓，我一定要知道你的思想。

sentences.english: I have taken an oath and confirmed it, that I will follow your righteous laws.
sentences.chinese: 你公義的典章，我曾起誓遵守，我必按誓而行。

sentences.english: She affirms to abrasion the chaplet that arise to be pears.
sentences.chinese: 她起誓要戴那些看起來像梨子的珍珠。

sentences.english: And Jonathan caused David to swear again, because he loved him: for he loved him as he loved his own soul.
sentences.chinese: 約拿單因愛大衛如同愛自己的性命，就使他再起誓。

sentences.english: I swear it by bronze and iron. "- Meera".
sentences.chinese: 我以青銅和鋼鐵的名義起誓。

sentences.english: 4He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to an idol or swear by what is false.
sentences.chinese: 就是手潔心清，不向虛妄，起誓不懷詭詐的人。

sentences.english: For I lift up my hand to heaven, and say, I live for ever.
sentences.chinese: 我向天舉手說，我憑我的永生起誓。

sentences.english: I have sworn, and I will perform [it], that I will keep thy righteous judgments.
sentences.chinese: 你公義的典章，我曾起誓遵守，我必按誓而行。

sentences.english: Unto whom I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest.
sentences.chinese: 所以我在怒中起誓，說，他們斷不可進入我的安息。

sentences.english: Obey the king's command, I say, because you took an oath before God.
sentences.chinese: 我勸你遵守王的命令，既指神起誓，理當如此。

sentences.english: So David gave his oath to Saul.
sentences.chinese: 於是大衛向掃羅起誓，掃羅就回家去。

sentences.english: They took an oath to the Lord with loud acclamation, with shouting and with trumpets and horns.
sentences.chinese: 他們就大聲歡呼，吹號吹角，向耶和華起誓。

sentences.english: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart;
sentences.chinese: 就是手潔心清，不向虛妄，起誓不懷詭詐的人。

sentences.english: I can swear by my reputation.

definition: to swear to God/to cross one's heart
to vow loyalty and devotion to
Holy Father/God the Father (in the Christian Trinity)
